Edgur smiled as the capsule warmed with reentry heat, he loved this part as the capsule rattled through the atmosphere. Although Edgur was perplexed, he wasn't scheduled to come home for another week but the big heads at the launch center wanted him home early, he was sad at first as the Kersolis Orbital Research Station had been his home for the past two months and he didn't want to see it go. He was lost in thought when he heard a loud WOMP and the sound of shearing metal Edgur quickly turned to the indicator lights and found he had no power to the rotation wheels, I can compensate for that he thought then all the emergency systems started going off in his ear. As Edgur hastily tried to figure out what was going on he glanced to his altimeter it read 200 meters.

Edgur woke up drenched in sweat as he laid there trying to figure out what he had dreamed about. He just couldn't remember he suddenly realized he was parched, he climbed out of bed and went to his fridge in his tiny dorm room at the K wing of the kerbalnaut complex at the BNK Industries Space and Aerospace Center (BNKISAC). Edgur knew these dreams had been going on for weeks it all started after his second rocket launch which had ended horribly and they were all the same. As he reached the fridge he grabbed a Tylonain Cocktail from the night before but as he realized by the pounding in his head he needed something else. Edgur walked over to the coffe pot and started brewing a pot of strong Kermbark brew as it was starting Edgur glanced at his clock it read 4:24. "Might as well start my day" he thought as he thought this he remembered it was mÃ…Â«nday he had a briefing this morning with the engineers about an upcoming mission.

"Edgur wait up!" Edgur turned around as his crew member and best friend Greglan ran up to him. "I just want to know if you knew anything about the briefing today, I heard it was about a mission to Duna." " I don't know anymore than you do but I am intrigued about what it's about." Edgur replied, as he sulked through the hallway Greglan looked at him puzzled. "What's wrong with you, did you one of those dreams again?" "Yeah there're really bugging me I just ca-" Edgur was cut off as a large explosion rocked the Kerbalnaut complex. "Oh for the love of Kracken those engineers need to test those rockets before they launch them!" Edgur ranted as they both turned to the large window in the hallway, the watched as debris rained down on the lawn of the BNKISAC, then Greglan turned to Edgur and said "How much do you wana to bet the capsule exploded? You're on we got 30 minutes anyway." Then they both ran off towards Greglan's jeep then to the VAB.

Edgur felt good with the 20 Kerbbux in his pocket as when he and Greglan had gotten over to the VAB the capsule slammed into the ground and disintegrated, Greglan then reluctantly handed over the money. "Kerm! The briefing we have to get to Vehicle System Check and Engine Testing!" (VSCET) Edgur and Greglan took off in the jeep before they were late. They burst in at the last minute, all heads turned towards them as they embarrassingly took their seats. "As I was saying" said the executive producer "I will be overseeing this project as our president is away on leave, now on with the presentation I will hand this over to our mission control director Greglan!" Greglan stepped up to the stand as applause swept through the audience. "Thank you Ladies and Kerbalmen as you know our Gecko Surface Probe we sent to Eve recently arrived there well I can now tell you now that" Greglan paused for dramatic effect, " it landed safe and sound and sent back the first pictures of Eve's surface!" The crowd erupted into cheers, whistles and applause. "Now please settle down I have more to tell you!" Gerglan had to shout to get his voice a-crossed to the crowd "as I said there is more, the pictures the probe sent us were successfully recovered." Greglan pressed a button and images of a barren purple landscape flashed onto a screen behind Greglan, also a bright purple sea came up this interested Edgur " This is peculiar I wonder what the composition of that sea is?" At that thought Edgur then raised his hand in which Greglan called on him. "Yes umm Greglan do you know what that sea is made of."" Actuality Edgur when the probe sent back data it couldn't get a reading on the liquid in the sea." Greglan then pulled up a graph on the screen it then showed an unreadable graph showing liquid makeup. "Now I have one more thing to say before I'm done, after seeing these images the President and his executives have decided that now...we plan a manned mission to Eve!" The crowd went berserk.
This is only the first of many posts and maybe I might add in some pics
